comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: Oct 4, 1913 Brooklyn Dodger Jake Daubert earns a new Chalmers auto as the first baseman won the Chalmers Award, a precursor to the National League MVP There have been three different "most valuable player" awards in baseball since 1911. The Chalmers Award was the first of those three and it was presented by between 1911 and 1914 by Chalmers Automotive — a Detroit based automobile company. www.baseball-almanac.com/awards/aw_chalm.shtml en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chalmers_Automobile

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Not sure where the Oct. 4 date came from in Kilted Cowboy's post, above.  I didn't find it in the cites.  Most likely this is Oct. 7, the first game of the World Series, judging from the crowds in the Polo Grounds.  We know they aren't there just to see a Dodger! (see next picture of Mayor Kline).
